meanings.definition: A small remaining quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: After the party, only a few remnants of cake were left.
meanings.sent2: She collected the remnants of fabric to make a patchwork quilt.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the remnants of yarn, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: The remnants of the old building stood as a reminder of the past.
meanings.sent5: The remnants of the sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: A surviving trace or vestige of something.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins are the remnants of a once great civilization.
meanings.sent2: His old journal is a poignant remnant of his youth.
meanings.sent3: The remnants of laughter echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent4: The remnants of her perfume lingered in the air long after she left.
meanings.sent5: The remnants of the old bridge hinted at its former grandeur.

meanings.definition: Remaining parts or fragments of something.
meanings.sent1: The remnants of the broken vase lay scattered on the floor.
meanings.sent2: He sifted through the remnants of the shipwreck searching for survivors.
meanings.sent3: The remnants of the puzzle were too few to complete the picture.
meanings.sent4: The remnants of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The remnants of the fallen leaves carpeted the forest floor.
